headline.main: STUDY SUGGESTS LINK OF CHEMICAL PLANTS AND TYPES OF CANCER

docs.lead_paragraph: A preliminary study of chemical risks by Congressional aides has turned up data that suggest a link between high rates of respiratory cancer and the locations of petrochemical plants in 133 counties in 27 states east of the Rocky Mountains. The three-month study, by the staff of Representative Guy V. Molinari, Republican of Staten Island, was not scientifically rigorous and cannot be used to draw conclusions, the researchers conceded. But they said the findings were intriguing enough to warrant a more detailed Congressional investigation into possible correlations between chemical plants and cancer.
